title: WPF SKGLElement has memory leaks
body:
### Description

`SKGLElement` inherits from https://github.com/opentk/GLWpfControl, when the `SKGLElement` is disposed it does not call the `Dispose` method of the base class, this causes memory leaks.

### Code

Here you can see the issue:

https://github.com/beto-rodriguez/SkiaSharp-wpf-memory-leak

Run the project, click on "click me", see the memory quickly growing, it never gets cleaned.

What i found out, is that older versions of OpenTK have this memory leak: https://github.com/opentk/GLWpfControl/issues/126

One solution is to update the OpenTK dependency to: (that pair of versions worked for me)

```xml
<PackageReference Include="OpenTK" Version="4.9.4" NoWarn="NU1701" />
<PackageReference Include="OpenTK.GLWpfControl" Version="4.3.3" />
```

Those versions already have the fix for https://github.com/opentk/GLWpfControl/issues/126 and also expose the `Dispose` method, which is not available in the current referenced version of OpenTK.

You can see the memory leak is gone with #3311.

SkiaSharpVersion with the issue: [3.119.0](https://www.nuget.org/packages/SkiaSharp/3.119.0)
Last working version: None.

### Expected Behavior

No leaks.
